VIII.iv.6.C.2.b
.
Effect of Prohibition on Pension Beneficiaries
No offset is required if a tort claim is concluded in favor of a Veteran who is
in receipt of pension, or
eligible for compensation under
38 U.S.C. 1151
, but elects to continue to receive pension in lieu of compensation.
However, the net proceeds of the settlement or judgment are considered countable income for pension purposes under
38 CFR 3.262(i)
and
38 CFR 3.271(g)
.
Note
:Â  Do
not
adjust a pension award to count the proceeds of a settlement or judgment without a notice of proposed adverse action unless the Veteran
is the source of the information, and
understands that the judgment will affect the amount of pension payable.
